result.execSummary:
The defendant Mason Thomas Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to St. Croix County Probation Office upon release.
Court STAYS balance of jail time to be served for revocation pending no new crimes are committed within 1 year.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be added to current payment plan through Clerk of Court.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Reconnect with Dunn County Re-Entry Program.
-Actively undergo treatment for mental health condition.
-Regularly attend AA Meetings and work with a sponsor.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Ronda B. or Donovan N. or their residence.
-Programming deemed appropriate by the Agent (MRT or Cognitive Intervention).
-Maintain employment.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

DE called stating he broke his collar bone, has been out of work, & would like to skip his Nov pymt. DE was advised that he may submit a request in writing to defer his Nov pymt & if he cannot fax it or drop it off, he must put it in the mail today or before 11-18-19. DE then stated he'll just borrow the money & make the pymt. DE was reminded again that he may submit a request if he would like. jaf

DE was advised that if an issue comes up in the future, to be sure to communicate w/the court to avoid any type of WA or being sent to Coll.  DE stated he would do so.  jaf

Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in  15CF446 but withholds entry of judgment in favor of the DJOC, court signs DJOC. Court finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF446.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H

- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rhonda B and Donovan N. and their residence. - Random and regular testing. 
- Cost of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Attend a victim impact panel. 
- Any additional programming that agent thinks is appropriate

** AMENDED**

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- Court will authorize a release of DE to mother or another adult relative to bring the DE to the Salvation Army Facility. 

- If DE obsconds, quits or is discharged against staff advice DE is to return immediately to St. Croix. County Jail. 

- DE to sign a release prior to leaving.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ronda B. or Donovan N.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Preliminary hearing at 09-29-2015 08:30 am

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ronda B. or Donovan N.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
